title: Company Effects Coordinator / Company Intelligence Officer
description: Lead Planner, Company Intelligence Officer and resource manager in support of the 120-man Infantry Company; advised the Commander on the use of these assets, and was the primary fire support trainer of all unit personnel. Coordinated support for local Iraqi governments and populations while deployed. Human Resource manager responsible for 10 Soldiers and all unit equipment valued in excess of $5,000,000.  Lead Humanitarian Coordinator responsible for over 15 Humanitarian Aid Projects valued in excess of $5,000,000. title: All-Source / Counterintellignce Analyst
description: DIA/APRC: Provide counterintelligence analysis to the DoD and Intelligence Community at the strategic level while supporting law enforcement and counterintelligence operations on a daily basis. Author analytical products on potential threats to U.S. and Allied Forces located within their host country and regional advisories during exercises and contingency operations. Monitor and coordinate with various agencies on foreign government intelligence involvement in WMD and military technology proliferation from various countries. Prepared and submitted numerous Intelligence Information Report Evaluations and Source Directed Requirements via HOTR to gather additional information for filling critical intelligence gaps and identify counter-proliferation opportunities. Research and extract large amounts of data from intelligence reports to be synthesized by various analytical tools for creating investigations. TECHNICAL PROFICIENCIES: • PALANTIR • VOLTRON • ICREACH • PROTON • QLIX • SWORDFISH • iS2 Notebook • TAC • WISE • ISM • RMT • NSA-Pulse • HOTR • MIDB/NPW • NGDS • RemoteView • ArcGIS • Google Earth • Joint Target Toolbox • Spoke Tools • INTELINK • Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, Power Point)

summary: Senior All-Source Intelligence and Counterintelligence Analyst expert in raw intelligence research, link and pattern analysis, target development on above and underground facilities, order of battle and imagery exploitation while fusing classified and oper-source information into high value informative and decision swaying products. Over 36 years of experience within the Department of Defense as a soldier, civil servant, and contractor with exceptional methodical writing and briefing skills. Proficient in HUMINT, SIGINT, MASINT, GEOINT and Multi-INT analysis with experience in WMD/CRBN and military technology proliferation, counterterrorism, counter-narcotics, asymmetric warfare, multinational operations, battle damage assessments, collection management, force protection and exercise development. Qualified security manager and approving authority of intelligence products for foreign disclosure.

title: Sergeant Major: 35X - Intelligence Senior Sergeant/Chief Intelligence Sergeant
description: Supervised the readiness and employment of military intelligence personnel in support of USARPAC’s mission. Provide in-depth analysis on specific possible threat areas located within the Pacific Theater. Wrote security standard operating procedures and inspected units (within CONUS and OCONUS) on physical, personnel and information security related issues. Provided country studies and briefings on military capabilities in various Southeast Asian countries and the possible threat within those countries to US national and international interests.

title: Lead All-Source Intelligence Analyst
description: Lead DIA Analyst for a team of 8 intelligence analysts within UFAC-A1. Managed the assignments and provided a monthly progress report on the number of GEMINI/MIDB records updated or created and coordinated with the collection manager on the status of RFIs. Beta tester on MIDB software and routinely provide feedback on problems incurred and solved. Additional duties were quality control manager, foreign disclosure officer and crisis action team member. Interface with the national intelligence community on underground related issues to insure that information in GENIMI/MIDB was correct and met the needs of the intelligence community. Retired after 32 years of service.

title: Mid HUMINT Targeting Officer (HTO)
description: • Assisted U.S. Southern Command (SOUTHCOM) with tasking and handling clandestine sources, planning and execution of operations, and preparing assessments for the operational environment. • Conducted analysis of raw and fused human intelligence data to assist with target development and asset validation using Palantir, M3, HotR, WISE, and Intelink search engines. • Expert command conducting Geo Metadata and Pattern of Life (POL) analysis. • Knowledgeable of HUMINT operational tactics, techniques, procedures (TTP), processes, programs, and policies within SOUTHCOM. • Supported, interfaced, and collaborated with DoD, IC, federal agencies, and law enforcement organizations. • Provided network analysis for SOUTHCOM elements using Analyst Notebook and Palantir. • Proficient using ICREACH, Firetruck, and Proton tools.

title: Watch Officer / OSINT Analyst
description: • Produced a daily Global IED report using real-time tactical Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) from social media information and social media analysis in support of JIEDDO. • Searched for and gathered IED related reports from a various social media sites including Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and NetVibes and performed geo-locations of pertinent data. • Monitored reporting from the Intelligence Community, Law Enforcement agencies and open sources to determine potential threats to the United States. • Provided early warning and alerts to key officials and facilitates the flow of critical information to those who need it on a timely basis.

description: • Conducted multi-layered, multi-intelligence analysis to define patterns of IED network activity in order to narrow the search space to conduct CIED operations using Google Earth and ArcGis 10. • Provided network analysis in support of counter-IED efforts and operations using Analyst Notebook and Palantir. • Produced intelligence targeting support products and reach-back support to forward-deployed elements in RC Southwest. • Researched, developed, and published SIGINT products at the tactical and operational level related to insurgent IED cell activities using SIGINT based analytical tools.

title: HUMINT Analyst/Collector
description: • Conducted 400+ strategic interrogations at a theater level for the Joint Interrogation Debriefing Center in Baghdad, Iraq and for the Detention Facility in Parwan, Afghanistan. • Produced over 100+ Intelligence Information Reports (IIRs) covering biographical and operational data on insurgent commanders, foreign fighters, facilitators and yielded strategic information which directly answered collection requirements at the national level. • Produced numerous link analysis charts of key insurgent networks in RC-SW and RC-East utilizing Analyst Notebook and Palantir. • Created geospatial products depicting Improvised Explosive Device (IED) trends and hot spots using ArcGIS and Google Earth. • Conducted 20+ Tactical interrogations at a Field Detention Facility in Jalalabad, Afghanistan resulting in five IIRs, which facilitated accurate targeting of Taliban members by providing insight into group structure, Taliban motivations, and the current dispositions of several key leaders and operators in Regional Command Capital. • Monitored over 2300 debriefings conducted by 12 different external agencies resulting in 0 violations in accordance with Geneva Conventions. • Assisted in developing the 201st MI BN’s Standard Operating Procedures regarding interrogation operations for the Joint Interrogation Debriefing Center in Baghdad, Iraq. • Instructed, supervised, and managed a team of five soldiers including counseling, mentoring, and evaluating performance.

title: Threat Analyst
description: - Exploited thousands of threat emitters over 200+ missions as part of Distributed Ground System-1 (DGS-1) - Provided direct threat warning of hostile electronic threats to airborne platforms and other theater consumers - Conducted conclusive investigative analysis on parametric data from unidentified electromagnetic emanations - Supported mission as an all-source analyst in Combat Fusion Cell; briefed commander daily - Deployed as a SIGINT Geospatial Metadata Analyst for a Special Operations Task Force in Iraq -- Section NCOIC; supported 160+ objectives by providing time sensitive pattern of life -- Provided time sensitive analytical support to targets of national interest, ensured accurate information regarding the collection and processing of activity reflected in reporting products - Deployed as a Close Target Reconnaissance Operator in Baghdad; captured 15 high value targets -- Augmented infantry units in over 100 combat missions by geo-locating threat signal emanations and sensitive site exploitation -- Served as Truck Commander for 30 Quick Reaction Force and Force Presence missions

title: Embedded Senior Intelligence Analyst
company: Combined Joint Special Operations Task Force - Afghanistan
description: Village Stability Operations (VSO) Analyst assigned to Operational Detachment Alpha (ODA) in a remote village in Southern Afghanistan. Coordinated all MASINT, IMINT, SIGINT and ISR for Human Terrain mapping, one hundred (100) published intelligence products on focusing on Tribal Dynamics, security, governance and economic development affecting Village Stability Operations. Conducted over three hundred (300) biometric enrollment, one hundred (100) counter-intelligence prescreening, over ten (10) sensitive site exploitation and instructed over two hundred (200) hours of military Tactic, Techniques and Procedures training in the development Pashmul region the Afghan Local Police (ALP) force.

title: On-the-Job Training (OJT) Manager
description: Primary responsible for overseeing and implementing the On the Job Training (OJT) program for six (6) OJT Marine Air Ground Task Force (MAGTF) Intelligence Specialist. Including training and observation of trainees with respect to their performance against established training objectives and recommendation of additional skill requirements as training needed. Training personnel using a combination of formal classroom courses, public briefing and speaking workshops, conducting daily pre/post-flight mission reports (MISREPs) instructions and assigning additional skill training requirements as trainees needed. Maintain organized log(s) of all training conducted and Follow up on a regular, planned schedule to answer questions and verify proficiency for attending MAGTF training facility.

title: Electronic Warfare Intelligence Analyst
description: Conducting over two hundred seventy five (275) pre/post mission briefs on the lines of an Electronic Attack, Electronic Support and Electronic Protection for Combat Operations throughout all of Iraq in Support of Operation Iraqi Freedom. Led two intelligence briefs on predictive analysis of enemy capabilities, hostile country Electronic air to air and ground to air threat tactics, directly guiding to successful completion of annual training requirements for eight (8) Electronic warfare mission commanders. AF/TP representative implementing, and enforcing measures to establish a level of protection against terrorist attacks.

title: Intelligence Chief
description: As the Intelligence Chief conducting personnel management, training and directing thirty-three (33) intelligence analyst with a $14 million dollar budget responsible for predictive analysis of enemy capabilities and tactics in support of ten (10) subordinate squadrons. Deploying five (5) squadron level intelligence teams support combat operations in Iraq. As the Assistant Security manager ensuring Flight Line Intelligence Center (FLIC), MAG-14 Headquarters and ten (10) subordinate compartments met or exceeded all Executive Orders, Dept. of Defense and Navy directives on classified materials facilities containing up to Top Secret Sensitive Compartmented Information.

title: Senior Air Analyst
description: insurgency, analyzed enemy activity and provided 2nd Marine Wing Commander with intelligence support all Marine combat missions in Iraq. Compiled, collated, analyzed, and evaluated all-source information to support three (3) downed aircraft missions identifying individuals, groups, non-governmental agencies, with potential links to extremist, terrorists, and terrorist organizations/networks converging on crash locations. Marine Intelligence analyst assigned to Joint Task Force Civil Support (JTF-CS) developing and reviewing prioritized intelligence requirements and corresponding DoD and Law enforcement intelligence reports, surveillance and reconnaissance collection requirements in support of current operations and contingency planning for a National Response Plan in response to a domestic chemical, biological, radiological and nuclear (CBRN) situation.

title: All-Source Intelligence Analyst
description: Kandahar Intelligence Fusion Center (KIFC) CJ2 Fusion Kandahar Team Noncommissioned Officer in Charge (NCOIC); Combined Joint Task Force 3 (CJTF-3), Headquarters Regional Command South (RC-S), Operation Enduring Freedom (OEF): Supervised the research and production of timely and relevant fused all-source intelligence assessments and products to support the RC-S Commanding General, ISAF Joint Command, subordinate units, Special Operations Task Forces, multi-national partners, and the intelligence community. Led, trained, and directed ten subordinate analysts and supervised the research, production, quality control, and dissemination of intelligence products. Synchronized and communicated the overall intelligence picture within Kandahar Province, Afghanistan, to include information on enemy forces, political and cultural influencers, and Afghan National Security Forces’ capabilities and leadership. Supervised the identification of intelligence gaps and development of HUMINT, SIGINT, IMINT, and ISR collection requirements to meet the Priority Information Requirements of the Commanding General RC(S). Oversaw the weekly production of Operations and Intelligence Briefings to the RC(S) command staff, a weekly Intelligence Summary, and the production of a weekly decision brief directing ISR allocation and decisive combat operations in RC(S). Trained subordinate all-source analysts in the use of available systems and databases, to include Palantir, M3, ArcGIS, MiRC, TAC, Google Earth, QueryTree, CIDNE, Analyst Notebook, and COIC UDOP.

title: Intelligence Analyst/Targeting Sergeant
description: Deployed to Afghanistan with 3rd Special Forces Group as the Joint Intelligence Operations Officer (2006) and to Iraq as the Senior Targeting Analyst (2008). Responsible for supervising, coordinating, and participating in analysis, processing and distribution of strategic and tactical intelligence of four Special Forces Battalions with a USCENTCOM and USEUCOM area of operations; used information derived from all intelligence disciplines to determine changes in enemy capabilities, vulnerabilities, and probable courses of action; provided support to the Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) synchronization process. • Provided critical intelligence analysis in support of over 55 Special Forces and Coalition Missions resulting in the capture of 85 insurgents during OIF • Successfully ensured unit Mission Essential Task List was applied to all intelligence operations; increased efficiency and accuracy by 60% • Responsible for maintaining a thorough knowledge of all plans, orders, force capabilities and operations in Afghanistan in order to provide recommendations and updates to the Commanding Officer • Performed as the information focal point for information dissemination throughout Afghanistan, ensuring that all pertinent information is shared with partner Intel/ops organizations • Monitored and maintained situational awareness of the current tactical, operational and strategic situation

summary: Senior Intelligent Analyst with 14 years of military experience, eight years of experience in intelligence community environments and four years’ experience in the Marine Corp Infantry with a proven record of identifying critical security shortcomings and offering strategic advice to upper levels of the military. As part of an analytical team I researched, developed, presented and published all-source intelligence products at the tactical and operational level related to insurgent activities and threats to local/regional stability. Results-driven with extensive experience in Military Intelligence and Amphibious Reconnaissance Units. Excellent working knowledge of intelligence technical systems. Experienced military leader who demonstrates the ability to solve problems, delegate, and achieve goals. Intelligence Applications Expertise: • Able to perform tasks with the following web-based intelligence tools, software, and databases: Multimedia Message Manager (M3), Tripwire Analytic Capability (TAC), NCTC Online, Terrorism Identities Datamart Environment (TIDE), ICReach SIGINT database, Cultweave SIGINT database, PROTON SIGINT database, Skope SIGINT analytical toolkit, Analyst Notebook 7/Palantir link analysis software, ArcGIS spatial analysis software, Google Earth spatial analysis software, SIPR, JWICS, and Microsoft productivity software and applications as needed Specialties: Clearance: Current Top Secret/SCI w/CI Poly

title: Maritime Security Specialist/Team Leader Corporal/E4
description: Deployed with 1st Marine Division as a Mortarman Team Leader, assigned to a Marine amphibious assault force, using combat rubber reconnaissance craft (CRRC). After deployment, was selected to be a part of the Maritime Special Purpose Force (MSPF) Platoon for 1st Marine Division. This platoon is a unique specialized sub-unit trained in hostage rescue, urban warfare, and was tasked as a TRAP (Tactical Recovery of Aircraft and Pilot) platoon when deployed overseas. • Trained in Close Quarters Battle (CQB), Explosive Breaching, Applied Military Demolition, and Containment Security in support of Maritime Special Purpose Force (MSPF) operations • Conducted training with joint military Special Operation forces and federal/local law enforcement agencies to ensure training remained current and relative • In charge of a 4-man infantry team. Responsible for the health, well-being, and performance of a fire team unit • Trained and supervised mortar team members in the tactical employment of 60 mm mortar as part of a Marine amphibious assault force, using combat rubber reconnaissance craft (CRRC) • Trained for and conducted OCONUS clandestine amphibious operations while assigned to 1st Marine Division while deployed to multiple countries

title: Operations SME
description: The intelligence subject matter expert position is a HUMINT analyst who will participate in exploitation of detainees to aid in the production, indications and warning, collection management, targeting, imagery, network analysis, counterintelligence, counter-terrorism, information operations, foreign disclosure, international engagements and threat analysis. Served as Team Lead for the high profile NAI CLT conducting VIP briefing and top of the analysis in support of tactical units in Afghanistan. Served as the Operations Lead for RC South managing over 50 analysts and operations professionals from Division to Battalion. Received a Letter of Appreciation from CPT Hamlin HQ CDR and Paladin J4 Kandahar Air Base Afghanistan. Received a Letter of appreciation from Senior Master Sergeant Green , COIC Operations NCOIC

title: Lead Intelligence Analyst
description: Deployed to Afghanistan serving as the Operations LNO and Lead All-Source Analyst for in RC-North. Prepared briefings for Army Major Commands in Afghanistan with emphasis on the use of IEDs by threat groups. As part of the intelligence cycle, conducted all-source intelligence research using databases and developed intelligence capability and threat assessments using intelligence information systems. Served as Senior All-Source Analyst for the Iraq MND Center/South Team preparing daily briefings for the MID Chief. Provided Human Intelligence (HUMINT) and All-Source Analysis support to combat units through research and dissemination of products on asymmetric threats, with emphasis on the use of IEDs by threat groups. Identified emerging trends and methods of operation in order to deter and interdict networks associated with the sourcing, production, delivery and emplacement of IEDs. Analyzed in-theater data to strengthen information gathering capabilities through fusion analysis. Planned, coordinated and synthesized research to produce all-source intelligence products through fusion analysis combining HUMINT, Signals Intelligence (SIGINT), IMINT, Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) and ISR Optimization to answer Requests for Support (RFS) at all levels.

title: Desk Officer
company: US Government, Office of Naval Intelligence
description: Supervised and coordinated activities of personnel assigned as HUMINT Collectors. Assumed responsibility for safekeeping of intelligence taken from prisoners, and all reporting procedures. Maintained direct oversight of Collectors in performing steps in the intelligence cycle such as Tasking, Processing, Production, Exploitation, and Dissemination. Received notification and informed commanding officers of Major Commands (SOUTHCOM, CENTCOM, EUCOM) of all collection efforts and reports completed. Researched electronic, manual, and automatic databases. Developed intelligence capability and threat assessments using intelligence information systems. Wrote information papers and intelligence articles and manipulated intelligence data and delivered briefings.

title: Counterterrorism Analyst
description: Performed in depth all-source analysis on subjects of counterterrorism interest in order to provide actionable intelligence in support of the FBI operational divisions, headquarters counterterrorism elements, field offices and Joint Terrorism Task Forces. Leveraged all-source intelligence research, exploitation and analytical methods as well as electronic, manual, and automatic databases to identify, validate, and or supplement current information on persons of investigative interest and interfaced with local and national clients and or agencies of the intelligence community as well as Major Commands. Liaised with case field agents and other analysts to establish analytical requirements and provide products. Produced information papers and finished analytical products for dissemination to a variety of Task Force consumers, often including visual representations such as link analysis. Provided technical guidance mentoring to colleagues and junior analysts regarding analytical methods and capabilities. Responded to requests for intelligence and background information from various customers.

title: All Source Intelligence Analyst
description: Supervised and managed three junior intelligence analysts of the intelligence section responsible for supporting U.S. Army Special Operations Forces (SOF) teams as well as Army Major Commands in the Iraq and Afghanistan Regions. Developed military intelligence fusion products on foreign ground forces techniques, tactics, and procedures, and provided intelligence to deployed U.S. Forces, force developers, and decision makers at both the national and worldwide levels. Monitored both domestic and international reporting to provide tactical, strategic and operational support to Special Forces Teams; this included producing daily intelligence and warning reports on imminent and emerging threats to Special Forces Teams operating outside of the US. Prepared and coordinated strategic and operational level all-source reports, presentations, and briefings with supporting documentation produced by members of the intelligence community. Wrote information papers and intelligence articles for SOF units. Manipulated intelligence data and delivered capability briefings. Researched electronic, manual, and automatic databases. Developed intelligence capability and threat assessments using intelligence information systems. Utilized intelligence analysis tools and databases such as ASAL-L, RWS, Falcon view, Analyst Notebook, Pathfinder, C2PC2, ArcGIS, Starlight and AMHS to produce timely and accurate reporting to operational elements.

title: Senior Operations Analyst
description: Provide operations advice to both SOF and conventional commanders and staff on all activities with regards to planning and synchronization of effort of JIEDDO- COIC support to deployed elements. Coordinate requests for support with other JIEDDO- COIC deployed assets as well as the JIEDDO-COIC headquarters. Ensure commanders are kept abreast of all current and emerging JIEDDO-COIC processes, methodologies, and Tactics, Techniques & Procedures (TTP) for attacking networks that employ IEDs. Provide advice to Commanders and their staff on how to best integrate JIEDDO-COIC capabilities into their ongoing operations and analytical efforts. Proficient in using the following web-based intelligence tools, software, and databases: Multimedia Message Manager (M3), Tripwire Analytic Capability (TAC), NCTC Online, Terrorism Identities Datamart Environment (TIDE), ICReach SIGINT database, Cultweave SIGINT database, PROTON SIGINT database, Skope SIGINT analytical toolkit, Analyst Notebook / Palantir link analysis software, ArcGIS spatial analysis software, Google Earth spatial analysis software, and Microsoft productivity software and applications. Also familiar with F3EAD, CALEB/IWA, Social Network Analysis and CARVER.

title: Regional Command West, Operations Lead
description: Assist in the deployment, coordination and command execution of assigned and attached units providing counter IED and direct training support advice to a combatant commander and his forces. Possess experience at tactical formations Brigade and up. Multiple combat, combat support and combat service support disciplines may be required or equivalent academic or defense industry functional areas. Develop and provide elements in identifying and addressing counter-IED capability gaps. Provide analytical tools, software development, and systems engineering support to ensure interoperability and integration of emerging counter-IED technologies and tactics, techniques and procedures. Interface with Combatant Commands, joint organizations, and OGAs on actions related to Joint IED Defeat initiatives. Provide the capability to analyze the intelligence; operational TTPs; training and materiel solution inter-relationships; and articulate an overarching strategy to combat asymmetric threats and IEDs. Observe, collect, develop, validate, and disseminate emerging IED Defeat tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs). Assist in identification, training, and integration of IED Defeat countermeasure technologies. Provide investigative (law enforcement)advice to unit commanders. Provide updates as required to JIEDDO OPS to ensure relevance of the JIEDDO strategy and counter-IED COP. Provide support for the execution of JIEDDO strategic actions supporting the integration of multiple Joint IED Defeat solutions throughout DoD.

title: Principal Operations Analyst
description: Provide operations advice to SOF commanders and staff on all activities with regards to planning and synchronization of effort of JIEDDO-COIC support to deployed SOF elements. Coordinate SOF requests for JIEDDO-COIC support with other JIEDDOCOIC deployed assets and the JIEDDO-COIC. Ensure SOF assets are kept abreast of all current and emerging JIEDDO-COIC processes, methodologies, and Tactics, Techniques & Procedures (TTP) for attacking networks that utilize IEDs. Considered an emerging authority, who applies extensive technical expertise. Develops technical solutions to complex problems. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignment.

title: Special Forces (Ret)
description: 18E - Senior Communications Expert Perform setup, configuration, operation, and maintenance of satellite communications network and global positioning equipment, integration of RF over fiber optic cabling; the effectiveness of critical agency assets. Preparing and briefing senior leaders of system capabilities and limitations and provide guidance and assistance in implementation of policy and procedures as it relates to daily operation, projects, and Continuity of Operations (COOP) plans. Planning, evaluating, selecting, and procuring necessary RF and encryption equipment or services to support the organization’s continuity of operations mission. Providing guidance on RF network security to include configurations, establishment of standard operating procedures (SOPs), and input on design analysis and support for the review of existing and future multi-node ground stations and operational system. The RF systems will integrate with the enterprise architecture necessary to assure the successful operation of an integrated GSA network capability supporting internal and external customers 18F - Intel Sergeant Employs conventional and unconventional warfare tactics and techniques in intelligence collection and processing. Provides tactical and technical guidance to the Detachment Commander, indigenous and allied personnel. Plans, organizes, trains, advises, assists and supervises indigenous and allied personnel on collection and processing of intelligence information. Performs intelligence and operational duties when task organized in preparation (isolation) for special missions and during operations. 18Z - Senior Enlisted Advisor Supervises, instructs and serves as the senior enlisted member for SF activities. Trains and maintains proficiency in all major duties associated with Special Forces. Performs joint, interagency, multi-national, combined, and coalition planning

title: All-source Analyst
description: Research and produce all-source, national-level threat studies and products. Generate products on threat capabilities, modus operandi, intentions, internal security, and operating environment in order to support national-level counterterrorism planning and operational missions. Produce concise tactical and strategic assessments for the most senior of national-level customers. Utilize a variety of analytical principles, concepts and methodologies to build all-source products and target development packages. Provide analysis and research for industry, infrastructure, technology, country, geographic area, biographic, and targeted vulnerabilities.

title: All-source Analyst
description: Member of an all-source readiness and support team, providing full-time recent and relevant counter-insurgency and counter-terrorism analytic assistance to government customers located in multiple domestic and international locations. Conducted all-source analysis, coordination, and support to different Military Services, elements of USSOCOM, COCOM, BCT/RCTs, CTCs, and NATO partners. Extensive historical and recent/relevant analysis of national and tactical intelligence assets using a variety of software and databases. I also disseminated, analyzed, and presented recent and relevant enemy tactics, techniques, and procedures as well as human terrain (politics, culture, economics, infrastructure, etc) and foreign policy in order to provide Red Team simulations related to USCENTCOM, USPACOM, and USAFRICOM AORs. Proficient with ArcGIS, Palantir, Analyst Notebook, and Google Earth.

title: Full-motion Video Imagery Analyst
description: Assigned to Global Analysis in support of the Global War on Terrorism. Served as part of a 24-hour all-source operations center serving multiple agencies and commands. Completed real-time intelligence analysis in support of US Government operations. Provided full-motion video exploitation and imagery analysis supporting current counterterrorism operations. Performed extensive historical analysis of national and tactical intelligence assets using a variety of intelligence software and databases. Contributed to the completion of “quick turnaround” projects for senior members of the US Intelligence Community. Completed Motion Imagery Training Intermediate-level Course; proficient with MAAS, Mission Marker, ClearCom, IEC, Microsoft Office, DVA, and various NGA products. Involved with BAE Systems Leadership activities, training, and Task Lead review boards.

title: All-source Analyst
description: Lead all-source analyst of a brigade level ASPS, normally held by higher rank. Drove analysis and conducted quality control over products later briefed to a brigade staff and utilized by deployed customers. Products included country studies, threat streams, and non-combatant evacuation operations planning and other products regarding CENTCOM/AFRICOM AORs. Designed studies and guided research using a variety of all-source programs and systems. Member of a platoon-sized, US Special Operations Forces (SOF) element during OEF as an all-source targeting analyst for TF. Analyzed information, created and maintained hundreds of products, and briefed key decision-makers in order to action on various threat streams in RC-E using a range of SIGINT, HUMINT, IMINT, and all-source analysis tools in a high-paced, intense environment. Also participated in FMV overwatch of HVT POL and missions. Software included ICReach, Fire Truck, Devious Denim, and SKOPE Toolkit. My team facilitated over 80 missions with an overall success rate of 82%. I volunteered for this assignment and was chosen above my peers. Member of lead analysts within a brigade level all-source production section during OIF, consisting of joint service personnel specializing in HUMINT, SIGINT, MASINT, IMINT, GEOINT, and all-source analysis. Developed and produced hundreds of intelligence products covering five provinces in Mid-Euphrates region of Iraq. Recognized as the subject matter expert for Najaf and Diwaniyah Provinces for my brigade during Operation Iraqi Freedom. Participated in the oversight of the 2010 National Iraqi Parliamentary Elections.

title: Intelligence Analyst
description: • Processed all source information and generated source directed requirements (SDRs) and collection plans in support of US Forces Korea. • Produced source validation and operational recommendations for five HUMINT Collection Teams during OIF. • Primary S2X representative to Brigade targeting meetings, briefing senior personnel on HUMINT capabilities and assessments of feasibility for future targeting operations. • Conducted social network analysis (SNA), open source data mining, and helped design spotting procedures for Special Operations Command Africa (SOCAFRICA). • Contributed to 300% increase in operations by planning and validating ISR strategy for Combined Special Operations Task Force-10 (CSOTF-10) during Operation Enduring Freedom (OEF). • Dynamically tasked and guided airborne IMINT/SIGINT assets for CSOTF-10 ground teams during OEF. • Researched, reviewed, edited and disseminated all-source theater intelligence briefs on foreign military capabilities and leadership for US Africa Command (AFRICOM) AOR. • Team Leader for analysts providing daily Order of Battle updates to United States Army Africa (USARAF) during Operation Unified Protector for use in targeting operations. • Member of theater level G2 staff planning during Arab Spring uprisings. • Proficient with multiple tools and web applications to include: Palantir, Analyst Notebook, CIDNE, ICReach, Cultweave, Swordfish-J, Biometric Automated Toolset (BATS), Terrorist Identities Datamart Enterprise (TIDE), SharePoint portals, HOT-R, Coliseum, M3, Harmony, ArcGIS, Google Earth. • One of two US partners on an OEF NATO operations floor, mentoring on the usage of ISR assets. • Developed exemplars and processes for improving HUMINT and Analytical Control Element (ACE) operations. • Constantly took lead on intelligence operations, excelling at organizing the team into its most efficient and effective model.

title: All-source Analyst
description: Member of an all-source readiness and support team, providing full-time recent and relevant counter-insurgency and counter-terrorism analytic assistance to government customers located in multiple domestic and international locations. Conducted all-source analysis, coordination, and support to different Military Services, elements of USSOCOM, COCOM, BCT/RCTs, CTCs, and NATO partners. Extensive historical and recent/relevant analysis of national and tactical intelligence assets using a variety of software and databases. I also disseminated, analyzed, and presented recent and relevant enemy tactics, techniques, and procedures as well as human terrain (politics, culture, economics, infrastructure, etc) and foreign policy in order to provide Red Team simulations related to USCENTCOM, USPACOM, and USAFRICOM AORs. Proficient with ArcGIS, Palantir, Analyst Notebook, and Google Earth.

title: Full-motion Video Imagery Analyst
description: Assigned to Global Analysis in support of the Global War on Terrorism. Served as part of a 24-hour all-source operations center serving multiple agencies and commands. Completed real-time intelligence analysis in support of US Government operations. Provided full-motion video exploitation and imagery analysis supporting current counterterrorism operations. Performed extensive historical analysis of national and tactical intelligence assets using a variety of intelligence software and databases. Contributed to the completion of “quick turnaround” projects for senior members of the US Intelligence Community. Completed Motion Imagery Training Intermediate-level Course; proficient with MAAS, Mission Marker, ClearCom, IEC, Microsoft Office, DVA, and various NGA products. Involved with BAE Systems Leadership activities, training, and Task Lead review boards.

title: All-source Analyst
description: Lead all-source analyst of a brigade level ASPS, normally held by higher rank. Drove analysis and conducted quality control over products later briefed to a brigade staff and utilized by deployed customers. Products included country studies, threat streams, and non-combatant evacuation operations planning and other products regarding CENTCOM/AFRICOM AORs. Designed studies and guided research using a variety of all-source programs and systems. Member of a platoon-sized, US Special Operations Forces (SOF) element during OEF as an all-source targeting analyst for TF. Analyzed information, created and maintained hundreds of products, and briefed key decision-makers in order to action on various threat streams in RC-E using a range of SIGINT, HUMINT, IMINT, and all-source analysis tools in a high-paced, intense environment. Also participated in FMV overwatch of HVT POL and missions. Software included ICReach, Fire Truck, Devious Denim, and SKOPE Toolkit. My team facilitated over 80 missions with an overall success rate of 82%. I volunteered for this assignment and was chosen above my peers. Member of lead analysts within a brigade level all-source production section during OIF, consisting of joint service personnel specializing in HUMINT, SIGINT, MASINT, IMINT, GEOINT, and all-source analysis. Developed and produced hundreds of intelligence products covering five provinces in Mid-Euphrates region of Iraq. Recognized as the subject matter expert for Najaf and Diwaniyah Provinces for my brigade during Operation Iraqi Freedom. Participated in the oversight of the 2010 National Iraqi Parliamentary Elections.

summary: Matthew Degn currently works in the DC area, at a Government Intelligence Facility as a Senior Intelligence/ Counterterrorism Analyst. His focus is Iran, AFG, and the Pakistan area of operations. Furthermore, he continues to serve as a Professor at American Military University, where he teaches courses on Counter-Terrorism, Intelligence, Iranian Analysis, and U.S. National Security. Professor Degn has extensive experience in the Middle East, serving most recently as a Senior Intelligence/Policy Adviser to the Iraqi Ministry of Interior in Baghdad. While there, he wrote policy defining the duties of various intelligence organizations in the fight against terrorism, cross-border insurgency, and domestic violent militias. Furthermore, he was the senior civilian adviser in the creation of the Iraqi Counter-terrorism Directorate, mentored Iraqi senior government intelligence officials at the Deputy Minister level, and witnessed the inner workings of the Iraqi government at the highest levels. His expertise and analysis has been quoted in the Washington Post, London Times, NPR, ABC Nightly News, and other worldwide media outlets. Matthew Degn has also been involved in the screening and interrogation process within Iraq. He served at Abu Ghraib prison, and was among the last Americans in the prison facility before its closing. He witnessed the harmful effects the infamous prison scandal had on U.S. foreign policy and the interrogation process. While in different prison facilities he has interviewed members of Al Qaida, Jaysh-al-Mahdi (Mahdi Army), Badr Corps, Iranian, Syrian, and Saudi insurgents, and members of other terrorist entities from Iraq and the surrounding region. Mr. Degn is the author of numerous essays and other writings with subjects ranging from foreign policy and violent militias to terrorist methodologies, private security companies in war, and the use of intelligence within the Middle East.Specialties:Project Management & Team Leadership; Inter-Agency Coordination & Management; Anti-Terrorism /Force Protection (AT/FP); Writing, Editing and Speaking Skills; Security assessments; Interview techniques; Security investigative analysis & reporting; Extensive understanding of Middle East region, developed through years of specialising in this region and being immersed in the culture; Intelligence planning and analysis; Risk and threat analysis; Security policy and planning; Strategic security.

summary: Matthew Degn currently works in the DC area, at a Government Intelligence Facility as a Senior Intelligence/ Counterterrorism Analyst. His focus is Iran, AFG, and the Pakistan area of operations. Furthermore, he continues to serve as a Professor at American Military University, where he teaches courses on Counter-Terrorism, Intelligence, Iranian Analysis, and U.S. National Security. Professor Degn has extensive experience in the Middle East, serving most recently as a Senior Intelligence/Policy Adviser to the Iraqi Ministry of Interior in Baghdad. While there, he wrote policy defining the duties of various intelligence organizations in the fight against terrorism, cross-border insurgency, and domestic violent militias. Furthermore, he was the senior civilian adviser in the creation of the Iraqi Counter-terrorism Directorate, mentored Iraqi senior government intelligence officials at the Deputy Minister level, and witnessed the inner workings of the Iraqi government at the highest levels. His expertise and analysis has been quoted in the Washington Post, London Times, NPR, ABC Nightly News, and other worldwide media outlets. Matthew Degn has also been involved in the screening and interrogation process within Iraq. He served at Abu Ghraib prison, and was among the last Americans in the prison facility before its closing. He witnessed the harmful effects the infamous prison scandal had on U.S. foreign policy and the interrogation process. While in different prison facilities he has interviewed members of Al Qaida, Jaysh-al-Mahdi (Mahdi Army), Badr Corps, Iranian, Syrian, and Saudi insurgents, and members of other terrorist entities from Iraq and the surrounding region. Mr. Degn is the author of numerous essays and other writings with subjects ranging from foreign policy and violent militias to terrorist methodologies, private security companies in war, and the use of intelligence within the Middle East.Specialties:Project Management & Team Leadership; Inter-Agency Coordination & Management; Anti-Terrorism /Force Protection (AT/FP); Writing, Editing and Speaking Skills; Security assessments; Interview techniques; Security investigative analysis & reporting; Extensive understanding of Middle East region, developed through years of specialising in this region and being immersed in the culture; Intelligence planning and analysis; Risk and threat analysis; Security policy and planning; Strategic security.

title: Program Director- Intelligence Studies Program
description: • Program Director, BA Intelligence Studies, American Military University- responsible for the hiring, scheduling, and teaching assignments within the Intelligence Studies Program consisting of over 1200 students and 70 professors monthly. This program is currently the largest Intelligence Studies program within the United States. • Professor responsibilities include educating, creating, and conducting courses within the Intelligence, Terrorism, and National Security arenas. Course subjects include: “National Security & Terrorism”, “The US Intelligence Community”, “Foreign Intelligence Organizations”, “Iranian Country Study” as well as additional studies. Lectures incorporate associated topics including: Intelligence methodologies, The Middle East and Iran, Morality, The Levant Region and Hezbollah, Israel and Palestine, Terrorism TTP, International Relations as well as other topics associated with the Intelligence community. • These classes integrate research, the mechanics of professional writing, and analysis skills to Graduate and Undergraduate students. • Responsible for representing AMU’s Intelligence Studies program at academic and Intelligence Community conferences, associations, and meetings throughout the United States.

summary: Matthew Degn currently works in the DC area, at a Government Intelligence Facility as a Senior Intelligence/ Counterterrorism Analyst. His focus is Iran, AFG, and the Pakistan area of operations. Furthermore, he continues to serve as a Professor at American Military University, where he teaches courses on Counter-Terrorism, Intelligence, Iranian Analysis, and U.S. National Security. Professor Degn has extensive experience in the Middle East, serving most recently as a Senior Intelligence/Policy Adviser to the Iraqi Ministry of Interior in Baghdad. While there, he wrote policy defining the duties of various intelligence organizations in the fight against terrorism, cross-border insurgency, and domestic violent militias. Furthermore, he was the senior civilian adviser in the creation of the Iraqi Counter-terrorism Directorate, mentored Iraqi senior government intelligence officials at the Deputy Minister level, and witnessed the inner workings of the Iraqi government at the highest levels. His expertise and analysis has been quoted in the Washington Post, London Times, NPR, ABC Nightly News, and other worldwide media outlets. Matthew Degn has also been involved in the screening and interrogation process within Iraq. He served at Abu Ghraib prison, and was among the last Americans in the prison facility before its closing. He witnessed the harmful effects the infamous prison scandal had on U.S. foreign policy and the interrogation process. While in different prison facilities he has interviewed members of Al Qaida, Jaysh-al-Mahdi (Mahdi Army), Badr Corps, Iranian, Syrian, and Saudi insurgents, and members of other terrorist entities from Iraq and the surrounding region. Mr. Degn is the author of numerous essays and other writings with subjects ranging from foreign policy and violent militias to terrorist methodologies, private security companies in war, and the use of intelligence within the Middle East.Specialties:Project Management & Team Leadership; Inter-Agency Coordination & Management; Anti-Terrorism /Force Protection (AT/FP); Writing, Editing and Speaking Skills; Security assessments; Interview techniques; Security investigative analysis & reporting; Extensive understanding of Middle East region, developed through years of specialising in this region and being immersed in the culture; Intelligence planning and analysis; Risk and threat analysis; Security policy and planning; Strategic security.

title: Senior Intelligence/Policy Advisor
company: Iraqi Ministry of Interior/ Intelligence and Counterterrorism Directorate - Baghdad, Iraq
description: • Responsible for developing strategic policy for the Ministry of Interior, Republic of Iraq on all aspects of Intelligence and Intelligence-Led Policing throughout the country. • Directly mentored senior cabinet level officials within the Iraqi Government- to include MG Hussein ali Kamal (Director of Iraqi CT Directorate), Dr. Rubai (Iraqi National Security Adviser), and Adnon al Alwaki (Director of Iraqi Intelligence) on all facets of Intelligence and Policy processes. This work also included meetings and associations with many leading figures within the armed Militia groups including Jaysh-i-Mahdi, Iraqi Wolf BDE (SOF), and Badr Corps and others of Iranian influence. • Researched and produced all-source counterterrorism studies and products in association with the Iraqi Counterterrorism Directorate. Populated many databases and disseminated a broad array of intelligence products to executive level USG, DoD, and coalition audiences. This included research and analysis of all-source data, HUMINT sources, associations, DOMEX, and other forms of Intelligence to produce various products on personalities involved in terrorist activities throughout the Middle East. • Produced specialized Intelligence about Iran, Hezbollah, HAMAS, al-Qaida, and armed Shi’a groups operating throughout Iraq and surrounding regions to include their tactics and operational capabilities, internal security, WMD potential, organizational facilities, and tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTP) in order to support national-level CT planning and SOF operational missions. • Senior Security Adviser on matters relating to the protection of the Iraqi Nation’s critical infrastructure and assets. • Directly responsible for the establishment of national policies having a direct impact on law enforcement/ Counter-Terrorism procedures at the National levels down to local townships.

title: National Security Screener/ Interrogator, Middle East Division – Baghdad, Iraq
description: • Screened and Interrogated various detainees including- resistance fighters, Iranian, Syrian, and Saudi foreign fighters, Hezbollah, al-Qaida, other terrorists and captives using various neuro-linguistic indicators, body language, voice intonation, and speech syntax in order to glean actionable intelligence of national security interest. • Authored and produced numerous written products evaluating and analyzing insurgent actions- to include the involved relationship between Sunni, Shi’a, and Kurdish factions; Jaysh al-Mahdi (JAM) or Mahdi Army, Badr Corps, and other militia groups of Iranian influence to include Hezbollah, HAMAS, and Iranian Intelligence. • Provided actionable intelligence and vulnerability assessments concerning Improvised Explosive Devises (IEDs) and other threats to Senior Coalition Planners, Iraqi & U.S. National Security Organizations, and tactical military units. • Managed, trained, and instructed Junior/ Mid-level National Security Screeners to understand the complex dichotomy of diverse insurgent groups, individuals, and international influences including- Foreign Intelligence and Security Services (FISS), various Terrorist Entities, and Narcotics-traffickers, as well as how to recognize and glean actionable intelligence during screenings and interrogations using numerous indicators and signs.

summary: Matthew Degn currently works in the DC area, at a Government Intelligence Facility as a Senior Intelligence/ Counterterrorism Analyst. His focus is Iran, AFG, and the Pakistan area of operations. Furthermore, he continues to serve as a Professor at American Military University, where he teaches courses on Counter-Terrorism, Intelligence, Iranian Analysis, and U.S. National Security. Professor Degn has extensive experience in the Middle East, serving most recently as a Senior Intelligence/Policy Adviser to the Iraqi Ministry of Interior in Baghdad. While there, he wrote policy defining the duties of various intelligence organizations in the fight against terrorism, cross-border insurgency, and domestic violent militias. Furthermore, he was the senior civilian adviser in the creation of the Iraqi Counter-terrorism Directorate, mentored Iraqi senior government intelligence officials at the Deputy Minister level, and witnessed the inner workings of the Iraqi government at the highest levels. His expertise and analysis has been quoted in the Washington Post, London Times, NPR, ABC Nightly News, and other worldwide media outlets. Matthew Degn has also been involved in the screening and interrogation process within Iraq. He served at Abu Ghraib prison, and was among the last Americans in the prison facility before its closing. He witnessed the harmful effects the infamous prison scandal had on U.S. foreign policy and the interrogation process. While in different prison facilities he has interviewed members of Al Qaida, Jaysh-al-Mahdi (Mahdi Army), Badr Corps, Iranian, Syrian, and Saudi insurgents, and members of other terrorist entities from Iraq and the surrounding region. Mr. Degn is the author of numerous essays and other writings with subjects ranging from foreign policy and violent militias to terrorist methodologies, private security companies in war, and the use of intelligence within the Middle East.Specialties:Project Management & Team Leadership; Inter-Agency Coordination & Management; Anti-Terrorism /Force Protection (AT/FP); Writing, Editing and Speaking Skills; Security assessments; Interview techniques; Security investigative analysis & reporting; Extensive understanding of Middle East region, developed through years of specialising in this region and being immersed in the culture; Intelligence planning and analysis; Risk and threat analysis; Security policy and planning; Strategic security.

title: Senior Biometrics Intelligence Analyst/Officer
description: • Accumulated, analyzed, and produced various written products regarding insurgent groups, and enemy bomb signatures throughout the Middle East using a variety of applications including ASAS, Palantir, JDISS, ICReach, Falconview, TAC, FIRETRUCK, ArcGIS, JWICS, TECS, Analyst Notebook, Pathfinder, IBIS systems, as well as message systems such as WISE, M3, and Tripwire, etc. • Evaluated and created documentation of Extremist/Terrorist biometric sensors and cyber threats, to better understand targeting style and determine threat status to Coalition Forces. • Provided military Order of Battle threat and risk assessments to CF Army Commands throughout the Middle East and AFRICOM, by performing comprehensive regional assessments of Foreign Intelligence and Security Services (FISS) to include Hezbollah, al-Qaida, and Iranian militia groups. • Created an IED and VBIED database to better identify terrorist methodology and danger to Allied troops in the Middle East. • Engaged in the triage process of all forms of exploitable media and DOMEX captured throughout Iraq, Afghanistan, and elsewhere in the Middle East. • Trained and managed up to 30 new biometrics intelligence analysts, and developed the education manual to be utilized in the progression of the junior/mid-level employees.

summary: Matthew Degn currently works in the DC area, at a Government Intelligence Facility as a Senior Intelligence/ Counterterrorism Analyst. His focus is Iran, AFG, and the Pakistan area of operations. Furthermore, he continues to serve as a Professor at American Military University, where he teaches courses on Counter-Terrorism, Intelligence, Iranian Analysis, and U.S. National Security. Professor Degn has extensive experience in the Middle East, serving most recently as a Senior Intelligence/Policy Adviser to the Iraqi Ministry of Interior in Baghdad. While there, he wrote policy defining the duties of various intelligence organizations in the fight against terrorism, cross-border insurgency, and domestic violent militias. Furthermore, he was the senior civilian adviser in the creation of the Iraqi Counter-terrorism Directorate, mentored Iraqi senior government intelligence officials at the Deputy Minister level, and witnessed the inner workings of the Iraqi government at the highest levels. His expertise and analysis has been quoted in the Washington Post, London Times, NPR, ABC Nightly News, and other worldwide media outlets. Matthew Degn has also been involved in the screening and interrogation process within Iraq. He served at Abu Ghraib prison, and was among the last Americans in the prison facility before its closing. He witnessed the harmful effects the infamous prison scandal had on U.S. foreign policy and the interrogation process. While in different prison facilities he has interviewed members of Al Qaida, Jaysh-al-Mahdi (Mahdi Army), Badr Corps, Iranian, Syrian, and Saudi insurgents, and members of other terrorist entities from Iraq and the surrounding region. Mr. Degn is the author of numerous essays and other writings with subjects ranging from foreign policy and violent militias to terrorist methodologies, private security companies in war, and the use of intelligence within the Middle East.Specialties:Project Management & Team Leadership; Inter-Agency Coordination & Management; Anti-Terrorism /Force Protection (AT/FP); Writing, Editing and Speaking Skills; Security assessments; Interview techniques; Security investigative analysis & reporting; Extensive understanding of Middle East region, developed through years of specialising in this region and being immersed in the culture; Intelligence planning and analysis; Risk and threat analysis; Security policy and planning; Strategic security.

title: Senior Counter Terrorism Analyst
description: • Collected, analyzed, and briefed classified intelligence for the Director of Intelligence, Department of Homeland Security Headquarters, Intelligence and Critical Infrastructure Sectors, as well as other executives within the Intelligence arena. • Provided Intelligence threats and vulnerability assessments to all Department of Homeland Security overseas and domestic offices, The White House, and State/ Local Law Enforcement; created region specific reports regarding domestic terrorist organizations and operations, cyber threats, maritime/naval threats, WMD proliferation, illicit cross border smuggling actions, and threats to critical infrastructure, in support of the War on Terror. • Utilized and monitored the numerous “Terrorist Watch Lists,” including those of the FBI, CIA, DEA, DHS, CENTCOM, PACOM, and the Terrorist Screening Center (TSC), etc., to help prevent illegal domestic border crossings.

summary: Matthew Degn currently works in the DC area, at a Government Intelligence Facility as a Senior Intelligence/ Counterterrorism Analyst. His focus is Iran, AFG, and the Pakistan area of operations. Furthermore, he continues to serve as a Professor at American Military University, where he teaches courses on Counter-Terrorism, Intelligence, Iranian Analysis, and U.S. National Security. Professor Degn has extensive experience in the Middle East, serving most recently as a Senior Intelligence/Policy Adviser to the Iraqi Ministry of Interior in Baghdad. While there, he wrote policy defining the duties of various intelligence organizations in the fight against terrorism, cross-border insurgency, and domestic violent militias. Furthermore, he was the senior civilian adviser in the creation of the Iraqi Counter-terrorism Directorate, mentored Iraqi senior government intelligence officials at the Deputy Minister level, and witnessed the inner workings of the Iraqi government at the highest levels. His expertise and analysis has been quoted in the Washington Post, London Times, NPR, ABC Nightly News, and other worldwide media outlets. Matthew Degn has also been involved in the screening and interrogation process within Iraq. He served at Abu Ghraib prison, and was among the last Americans in the prison facility before its closing. He witnessed the harmful effects the infamous prison scandal had on U.S. foreign policy and the interrogation process. While in different prison facilities he has interviewed members of Al Qaida, Jaysh-al-Mahdi (Mahdi Army), Badr Corps, Iranian, Syrian, and Saudi insurgents, and members of other terrorist entities from Iraq and the surrounding region. Mr. Degn is the author of numerous essays and other writings with subjects ranging from foreign policy and violent militias to terrorist methodologies, private security companies in war, and the use of intelligence within the Middle East.Specialties:Project Management & Team Leadership; Inter-Agency Coordination & Management; Anti-Terrorism /Force Protection (AT/FP); Writing, Editing and Speaking Skills; Security assessments; Interview techniques; Security investigative analysis & reporting; Extensive understanding of Middle East region, developed through years of specialising in this region and being immersed in the culture; Intelligence planning and analysis; Risk and threat analysis; Security policy and planning; Strategic security.

summary: Available for Immediate Hire, I am open to going back to Afghanistan, and I am open to positions in D.C/VA/OH. 14 years of intelligence analyst experience that includes HUMINT, CI, IMINT, SIGINT, Targeting, , Open Source and, All-Source. Contractor for 5 years, and in the military for 7 years. Experience with SOF Units, SOCOM, DHS, U.S Army, DIA and U.S Air Force. Have been on six deployments, three to Afghanistan, one to Kuwait, one to Turkmenistan and one to the Philippines. • Senior Expert level with 12 years of experience with: Analyst Notebook, Command and Control Personal Computer (C2PC), ARCVIEW, ArcGIS spatial analysts software, Palantir, Intelligence Analysis System (IAS), Terrorism Identities Datamart Environ-ment (TIDE),, Multimedia Message Manager (M3), AMHS, Tripwire Analytic Capabil-ity (TAC), Lexis Nexis, All Source Analyst System (ASAS LITE), Joint Intelligence Op-erations Capability (JIOC-I), Falcon View, surveillance and reconnaissance (ISR) Synchronization process and the Global Command and Control System (GCCS) and Land Cover Analysis Tool (LCAT) and all the Red Disk components • Senior Expert level with 9 years of experience: in using Lexis Nexis, Automated Message Handling Systems (AMHS), National Counterterrorism Center Online (NCTC Online), Emergency Operations Center (WebEOC) and Lotus Notes Databases. •Strong knowledge in Department of Defense, United States Air Force and Army procedures, regional geography and general knowledge.

summary: Available for Immediate Hire, I am open to going back to Afghanistan, and I am open to positions in D.C/VA/OH. 14 years of intelligence analyst experience that includes HUMINT, CI, IMINT, SIGINT, Targeting, , Open Source and, All-Source. Contractor for 5 years, and in the military for 7 years. Experience with SOF Units, SOCOM, DHS, U.S Army, DIA and U.S Air Force. Have been on six deployments, three to Afghanistan, one to Kuwait, one to Turkmenistan and one to the Philippines. • Senior Expert level with 12 years of experience with: Analyst Notebook, Command and Control Personal Computer (C2PC), ARCVIEW, ArcGIS spatial analysts software, Palantir, Intelligence Analysis System (IAS), Terrorism Identities Datamart Environ-ment (TIDE),, Multimedia Message Manager (M3), AMHS, Tripwire Analytic Capabil-ity (TAC), Lexis Nexis, All Source Analyst System (ASAS LITE), Joint Intelligence Op-erations Capability (JIOC-I), Falcon View, surveillance and reconnaissance (ISR) Synchronization process and the Global Command and Control System (GCCS) and Land Cover Analysis Tool (LCAT) and all the Red Disk components • Senior Expert level with 9 years of experience: in using Lexis Nexis, Automated Message Handling Systems (AMHS), National Counterterrorism Center Online (NCTC Online), Emergency Operations Center (WebEOC) and Lotus Notes Databases. •Strong knowledge in Department of Defense, United States Air Force and Army procedures, regional geography and general knowledge.

description: • Provided risk analytic support to identifying risk highlights and trends (potential threats, vulnerabilities, and consequences) for critical infrastructure protection • Supported the development of analytic products that look at key risk topics for HITRAC, the Office of Infrastructure Protection, and DHS • Supported all-source analysis for the Committee on Foreign Investments in the US (CFIUS) process •Provided and briefed senior leadership with a daily intelligence report on situations that could affect the United States.

title: Senior CI/Intelligence Analyst/Targeting
description: • Supported Special Operations Forces by providing analysis, reporting, databasing and dissemination of Afghanistan measures of stability which include security, governance and development, Human Terrain Analysis, High Value Individual Targeting products, Extremist and Regional Threat Network Nodal Analysis, Preparation of Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance Assessment products to gauge the effectiveness of collection operations, and all-source exploitation of documents and media from detainees •Researched, developed, presented and published all-source intelligence products at the tactical, operational and strategic level related to Military actions, insurgent activities, economic and political activities, and threats to regional stability as part of an overall analytical team •Responsible for intelligence analysis related to counter-terrorism, HUMINT, SIGINT, counterintelligence, Afghanistan and South West Asia regional issues, political/military analysis and support to targeting •Personally created targeting folders and provided intelligence on more than 10 individuals that led to their captures or death..

title: Passport and Visa Specialist/ Intelligence Analyst
description: •Created new tracking system that coordinated the access and control of passports for current unit program. Created website using HTML, providing individual and unit information on correct process and procedures to obtain Passport and Visa meeting foreign travel entry requirements •Supported Special Operations Forces by maintaining over 60 Passports Unit wide including Diplomatic, Official and Tourist. •Maintained training documents and proper procedure documents on Passports and Visas. •Briefed the Unit Commander and Program Manager on a daily basis regarding their program •Provided information to the Commander on what changes they need to do in near future to make their program easier, and how to save money regarding their travel program •Assist unit program manager and departmental commanders in the processing, documentation and administrative control of travel request. Initiate policy and procedures developing processing programs, training and ensuring unit personnel complete all requirements

summary: Available for Immediate Hire, I am open to going back to Afghanistan, and I am open to positions in D.C/VA/OH. 14 years of intelligence analyst experience that includes HUMINT, CI, IMINT, SIGINT, Targeting, , Open Source and, All-Source. Contractor for 5 years, and in the military for 7 years. Experience with SOF Units, SOCOM, DHS, U.S Army, DIA and U.S Air Force. Have been on six deployments, three to Afghanistan, one to Kuwait, one to Turkmenistan and one to the Philippines. • Senior Expert level with 12 years of experience with: Analyst Notebook, Command and Control Personal Computer (C2PC), ARCVIEW, ArcGIS spatial analysts software, Palantir, Intelligence Analysis System (IAS), Terrorism Identities Datamart Environ-ment (TIDE),, Multimedia Message Manager (M3), AMHS, Tripwire Analytic Capabil-ity (TAC), Lexis Nexis, All Source Analyst System (ASAS LITE), Joint Intelligence Op-erations Capability (JIOC-I), Falcon View, surveillance and reconnaissance (ISR) Synchronization process and the Global Command and Control System (GCCS) and Land Cover Analysis Tool (LCAT) and all the Red Disk components • Senior Expert level with 9 years of experience: in using Lexis Nexis, Automated Message Handling Systems (AMHS), National Counterterrorism Center Online (NCTC Online), Emergency Operations Center (WebEOC) and Lotus Notes Databases. •Strong knowledge in Department of Defense, United States Air Force and Army procedures, regional geography and general knowledge.

title: Intelligence Analyst / Critical Infrastructure Risk Management Analyst
description: • Provided day-to-day maintenance and content management support to the INTELINK-U Homeland Security Central website and portals. • Reviewed, formatted, and uploaded various DHS and community open source products to the Homeland Security Information Network (HSIN) portals. • Coordinated with various offices inside of DHS and the DNI in order provide significant upgrades, adjustments, and maintenance of open source information sharing websites and portals. • Located, tested, and recommended the utilization of new tools and technologies in reference to open source collection and dissemination. • Assisted Department and State and Local offices in obtaining access to key national open source dissemination portals. • Identified information sharing opportunities within the Department, the IC, and State and Local partners in order to enhance open source product integration.; Provided strategic situational awareness for DHS National Protection and Programs Directorate (NPPD) and the Office of Infrastructure Protection (IP) leadership. • Supported operational intelligence and decision making support across the full spectrum of incident management, including awareness, prevention, protection, response, and recovery. • Coordinated and developed recommendations to IP leadership for the protection and restoration to national Critical Infrastructure and Key Resources (CIKR). • Provided 24hr update briefings on Hurricanes (Current Location, Strength, Potential Damage) to the IP Leadership during Hurricane Season. • Prepared and briefed the Incident Daily Update Brief to the Assistant Secretary of Infrastructure Protection and coordinated senior leadership and private sector teleconferences. • Oversaw the collection, analysis, and dissemination of information regarding the status of CIKR during a national incident or critical event.

title: Intelligence Analyst and Emergency Actions Controller
description: • Analyzed Daily Intelligence Reports from around the AOR and provided a daily brief to the Base Commanders while deployed in Afghanistan (Twice), Turkmenistan, Philippines and Kuwait • Deployed to Afghanistan (twice), Turkmenistan, Philippines and Kuwait to help run the Command Post there and provided HUMINT/All-Source/SIGINT/GEOINT Intelligence on the Taliban, foreign nations that are supporting the Taliban and other INS groups, as well as providing security management for the surrounding area. • Performed nuclear Command and Control (C2) actions in the execution phase of Emergency War Orders and directed conventional C2 actions supporting Emergency Plans, Operations Orders, and Operation Plans • Classified Information and Materials Security • Tracked and Coordinated movement for all VIP aircraft from the President of the United States, to the Congress and military leaders • Security emergency manager at Andrews and Kadena AFB, Kuwait, Afghanistan, Turkmenistan and Philippines locations. • Served as a liaison with counterparts in the Air Force, Army, and CIA participating in continuity of operations (COOP) and continuity of government (COG) related activities and operations to coordinate overall response • Provided guidance to the Commanders for establishing essential functions, and ensuring headquarters operations and emergency resources continue with minimal disruption during emergencies • Provided input and assist in the development of COOP strategic planning documents for the Air Force and the Army • Provided oversight and assessment of the status of emergency capabilities for the Bases that I was stationed at

title: All Source Analyst
description: • Served as the Diyala Intelligence Analyst for the Multi-National Division-North (MND-N) Cell in the All-Source section of the Coalition Analysis and Control Element (CACE) • Supervised a team of enlisted service members that provided invaluable analytical support, assessments concerning trends and activities of threat groups, and High Value Individuals (HVI) • Produced over 180 products and provided actionable intelligence with efficiency and accuracy • Provided continuous situational awareness of the battlefield to the Commanding General (CG) and his staff by producing over 1200 intelligence products, 96 Story Boards, and 62 GRINTSUMs • Identified by the CACE Chief to participate in an analyst exchange with the 25th ID Analysis and Control Element (ACE), serving as MNC-I C2 CACE liaison officer during provincial elections

title: Multiple Source Fusion Analyst
description: • Held the position of lead analyst in the creation of All Source Eyelid Reports (ASER) that identified potential areas of interest for the customer in Afghanistan--these products resulted in multiple IED discoveries • Utilized Outlook, MS Power Point, MS Word, MS Excel, DCGS-A, M3, PSI Jabber, ArcMap, Query Tree, CIDNE, and Google Earth • Analyzed multiple-source reporting in order to help complete both long term and short term studies, answering the costumer’s request for information • Built Analyst Notebook charts that provided a break down of various terror networks within assigned AO. Also provided a break down of the tribal leaders and political leaders within the assigned Province • Utilized multiple levels of intelligence, to include HUMINT collection and SIGINT collection, to identify threats and to support Counter IED (C-IED) missions for various Task Forces
